result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Wayne Gable

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
*Upon being outfitted with an electronic monitoring bracelet and treatment lined up*
Standard conditions:
Add'l conditions:
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements.

3:14 PM Defendant Christopher Wayne Gable in court, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino in court for Christopher Wayne Gable.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Timothy Mcmullen- sworn and testified. D, X.
Witness identifies defendant in court.
Exhibit 1- Certified copy of JOC-19CF867. MIOR
Probable Cause Found, Defendant bound over.
Information filed/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered all Counts. 
Defense request to address bond- no objection by the state as their are no victim issues. Defense requesting court amend the bond to a signature bond or adjust to $500 cash max. State has no objection to lowering the cash bond. Court modifies the bond to a $5,000 signature bond upon defendant being outfitted for electronic monitoring bracelet and treatment lined up.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on January 10, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements  - UA's

11:19 AM Defendant Christopher Wayne Gable appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by video for Christopher Wayne Gable.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of rights. Received complaint/waived reading. Preliminary hearing requested. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
